newsitem.title: USA: Stimsonite sees year net at or below estimates.
newsitem.headline: Stimsonite sees year net at or below estimates.

text.p: Stimsonite Corp said Wednesday it expects full year earnings to be at or below the low end of the range of analysts' projections.
According to First Call, analysts estimate Stimsonite year earnings in a range of $0.70 to $0.73 a share. The company earned $0.29 in 1995.
"As noted previously, both our optical film and international business units have not achieved their expected 1996 sales growth," said President Jay Taylor.
Stimsonite makes and markets highway safety products.

During the first half of the year, sales and earnings benefited from strong growth in the company's domestic highway delineation product lines. This part of the domestic business is expected to continue to show growth in the second half, but it will be at a lower rate than during the first half of the year, he said.
Stimsonite shares were trading at 7-1/8, unchanged from yesterday's close.
